title: China’s Unrestricted Warfare, Part 2
description: In the early 2000s, Nortel was consciously, intentionally, aggressively positioning itself as a partner and a friend of China. At the same time, it was China's number one target for corporate espionage - and an early victim of its new 'Unrestricted Warfare' doctrine.
content:encoded: In the early 2000s, Nortel was consciously, intentionally, aggressively positioning itself as a partner and a friend of China. At the same time, it was China’s number one target for corporate espionage – and an early victim of its new ‘Unrestricted Warfare’ doctrine.
